1.name: The Wizard of Oz
1.description: Dorothy Gale is swept away from a farm in Kansas to a magical land of Oz in a tornado and embarks on a quest with her new friends to see the Wizard who can help her return home to Kansas and help her friends as well.

2.name: Gone with the Wind
2.description: A manipulative woman and a roguish man conduct a turbulent romance during the American Civil War and Reconstruction periods.

3.name: Ninotchka
3.description: A stern Russian woman sent to Paris on official business finds herself attracted to a man who represents everything she is supposed to detest.

4.name: Jamaica Inn
4.description: In Cornwall in 1819, a young woman discovers that she's living near a gang of criminals who arrange shipwrecks for profit.

5.name: Stagecoach
5.description: A group of people traveling on a stagecoach find their journey complicated by the threat of Geronimo and learn something about each other in the process.

6.name: Mr. Smith Goes to Washington
6.description: A naive man is appointed to fill a vacancy in the United States Senate. His plans promptly collide with political corruption, but he doesn't back down.

7.name: The Hunchback of Notre Dame
7.description: In 15th century France, a gypsy girl is framed for murder by the infatuated Chief Justice, and only the deformed bellringer of Notre Dame Cathedral can save her.

8.name: Wuthering Heights
8.description: A servant in the house of Wuthering Heights tells a traveller the unfortunate tale of lovers Cathy and Heathcliff.

9.name: The Women
9.description: A study of the lives and romantic entanglements of various interconnected women.

10.name: La règle du jeu
10.description: A bourgeois life in France at the onset of World War II, as the rich and their poor servants meet up at a French chateau.

11.name: The Flying Deuces
11.description: Ollie has fallen in love with the innkeeper's daughter in Paris. The only problem - she's very much in love with her husband. To forget her he joins the Foreign Legion with Stan. Bad idea.

12.name: Trouble in Sundown
12.description: The bank has been robbed, the night watchman killed and the safe opened. The townspeople want John as he was the only one with the combination. Clint gets John out of town but before the ...                See full summary »

13.name: The Roaring Twenties
13.description: Three men attempt to make a living in Prohibitionist America after returning home from fighting together in World War I.

14.name: The Hound of the Baskervilles
14.description: Sherlock Holmes and Dr Watson investigate the legend of a supernatural hound, a beast that may be stalking a young heir on the fog-shrouded moorland that makes up his estate.

15.name: The Little Princess
15.description: A little girl is left by her father in an exclusive seminary for girls, due to her father having to go to South Africa to fight in the Second Boer War.

16.name: The Fighting Gringo
16.description: Ben Wallace is after Don Aliso's rancho. After falsifying his land survey, he frames him for murder. But Wallace has a dull-witted accomplice in Rance Potter and this is who Wade Barton ...                See full summary »

17.name: Zenobia
17.description: A modest country doctor in the antebellum South has to contend with his daughter's upcoming marriage and an affectionate medicine show elephant.

18.name: Only Angels Have Wings
18.description: At a remote South American trading port, the manager of an air freight company is forced to risk his pilots' lives in order to win an important contract.

19.name: Goodbye, Mr. Chips
19.description: An aged teacher and former headmaster of a boarding school recalls his career and his personal life over the decades.

20.name: Of Mice and Men
20.description: Two itinerant migrant workers, one mentally disabled and the other his carer, take jobs as ranch hands during the Great Depression to fulfill their shared dream of owning their own ranch.

21.name: Son of Frankenstein
21.description: One of the sons of Frankenstein finds his father's monster in a coma and revives him, only to find out he is controlled by Ygor who is bent on revenge.

22.name: Gunga Din
22.description: In 19th century India, three British soldiers and a native waterbearer must stop a secret mass revival of the murderous Thuggee cult before it can rampage across the land.

23.name: Dark Victory
23.description: A young socialite is diagnosed with an inoperable brain tumor, and must decide whether or not she'll meet her final days with dignity.

24.name: Destry Rides Again
24.description: When a tough western town needs taming, the mild-mannered son of a hard-nosed sheriff gets the job.

25.name: Gulliver's Travels
25.description: Gulliver washes ashore on Lilliput and attempts to prevent war between that tiny kingdom and its equally minuscule rival, Blefuscu, as well as smooth the way for the romance between the ...                See full summary »

26.name: Made for Each Other
26.description: While on a business trip, an ambitious young lawyer meets and immediately falls in love with a stranger. They wed the following day, and tragedy soon strikes.

27.name: Beau Geste
27.description: Three adopted English brothers join the French Foreign Legion in North Africa, after one of them steals their adoptive family's famous heirloom sapphire.

28.name: The Four Feathers
28.description: A timid British Army officer has quit and burns his last day summons to a war in Egypt. Calling him a coward, his girl friend and 3 officer friends give him a white feather. In redemption, he shadows his friends in war to save their lives.

29.name: Young Mr. Lincoln
29.description: A fictionalized account of the early life of the American president as a young lawyer facing his greatest court case.

30.name: The Cat and the Canary
30.description: When an eccentric family meets in their uncle's remote, decaying mansion on the tenth anniversary of his death for the reading of his will, murder and madness follow.

31.name: Union Pacific
31.description: In 1862, Central Pacific and Union Pacific Railroads compete westward across the wilderness toward California.

32.name: The Adventures of Sherlock Holmes
32.description: The master sleuth hunts his archenemy, Professor Moriarty, who is planning the crime of the century.

33.name: A Chump at Oxford
33.description: As a reward for capturing a bank robber, Stan and Ollie get scholarship to Oxford, but are met with resentment by other students.

34.name: Drums Along the Mohawk
34.description: Newlyweds Gil and Lana Martin try to establish a farm in the Mohawk Valley but are menaced by Indians and Tories as the Revolutionary War begins.

35.name: Dodge City
35.description: A Texas cattle agent witnesses first hand, the brutal lawlessness of Dodge City and takes the job of sheriff to clean the town up.

36.name: Love Affair
36.description: A French playboy and an American former nightclub singer fall in love aboard a ship. They arrange to reunite six months later, after he has had a chance to earn a decent living.

37.name: Another Thin Man
37.description: An explosives manufacturer suspects a young man is out to kill him. He calls in new parents Nick and Nora to sort things out.

38.name: They Made Me a Criminal
38.description: A boxer flees believing he has comitted a murder while he was drunk.

39.name: Midnight Shadow
39.description: In a quiet, all-black Oklahoma community live the Wilsons, whose pretty daughter Margaret is courted by awkward Buster and suave stage mentalist Prince Alihabad. On one busy night, Mr. ...                See full summary »

40.name: Nancy Drew and the Hidden Staircase
40.description: Nancy helps two aging spinsters fulfill the byzantine provisions of their father's will, but the murder of their chauffeur complicates matters.

41.name: Five Came Back
41.description: Twelve people are aboard Coast Air Line's flagship the Silver Queen enroute to South America when the airplane encounters a storm and is blown off course. Crashing into jungles known to be ...                See full summary »

42.name: The Man in the Iron Mask
42.description: Despotic King Louis XIV discovers he has a twin brother who has grown up under the tutelage of his foster father, the patriotic musketeer D'Artagnan.

43.name: In Name Only
43.description: After a wealthy man finds out his wife is a gold digger, he meets and falls for a widowed mother, and complications ensue.

44.name: Jesse James
44.description: After railroad agents forcibly evict the James family from their family farm, Jesse and Frank turn to banditry for revenge.

45.name: At the Circus
45.description: The Marx Brothers try to help the owner of a circus recover some stolen funds before he finds himself out of a job.

46.name: Each Dawn I Die
46.description: A corrupt D.A. with governatorial ambitions is annoyed by an investigative reporter's criticism of his criminal activities and decides to frame the reporter for manslaughter in order to silence him.

47.name: Babes in Arms
47.description: A group of vaudevillians struggling to compete with talkies hits the road hoping for a comeback. Frustrated to be left behind, all of their kids put on a show themselves to raise money for the families and to prove they've got talent, too.

48.name: Midnight
48.description: A chorus girl stranded in Paris is set up by a millionaire to break up his wife's affair with another man, while being romantically pursued by a cab driver.

49.name: The Rains Came
49.description: Living in India with her crude husband, a British aristocrat is reunited with an old flame at a party, though she truly has her sights set on a handsome doctor.

50.name: Tower of London
50.description: In the 15th century Richard Duke of Gloucester, aided by his club-footed executioner Mord, eliminates those ahead of him in succession to the throne, then occupied by his brother King ...                See full summary »
